XI.ii.3.B.3.i
.
Example:  Calculating the Time Limit When a Section 5103 Notice Was Sent to the Original Claimant and Has Expired
Situation
:
On 04/01/2019, VA received a claim for SC for a right hip condition.
On 04/02/2019, the Veteran was sent an adequate Section 5103 notice on a pending claim for right hip condition.
On 06/23/2019, the Veteran died and prior to the Veteran’s death, no additional evidence was submitted that required development.
Result
:  Since the full 30 days for the Section 5103 notice had passed, no additional time is required, and a decision should be made on the right hip condition.  A decision notice should be sent to the substitute claimant.  The substitute claimant will receive the same rights as the Veteran would have received, but for their death, to submit a decision review request or to appeal the decision of the right hip condition.
title: M21-1, Part XI, Subpart ii, Chapter 3, Section B  - Substitution in Case of Death of Claimant
citation: Part XI, Subpart ii, Chapter 3, Section B
